Interface playn.core.gl.GLBuffer

Changed Methods
void bind(int) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Issues the GL call to bind this buffer.
int byteSize() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. The size of the data in this buffer, in bytes.
int capacity() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns the total capacity of this buffer (number of floats, shorts, etc.
void destroy() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Releases any GL resources used by this buffer.
void expand(int) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Expands the buffer to accommodate the specified new capacity.
void flush() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Flushes this buffer's staging array to its underlying NIO buffer (if any).
int position() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Returns the current position of the buffer pointer (which is also the number of elements currently occupied in the buffer).
void reset() Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Resets this buffer's position to zero.
int send(int, int) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Sends this buffer's data to GL, using glBufferData.
void skip(int) Changed from non-abstract to abstract. Advances the position of this buffer without writing any data to it.
